title: been one or two months since the forum rule change.... mods need to wake up again....
body:
Art praise in meme and games, people talking about there disabilities in concept and creations in hopes riot will reach out to them for a personal contact to give their unlisted creations, necroing of random 2+ year threads (when crurator has said that was not allowed), ect

be nice if the mods would start doing their jobs again. I would be more than happy to point you guys directly to threads that break the rules but then i would get in trouble for naming and shaming... The threads are getting reported through the system.

Let me guess, i need to send a ticket to riot so the will tell the mods to their job (again)

replies.body:
You have that nice little REPORT button on the right side of every OP. Nothing is preventing you helping the mods out by reporting the invalid threads. Then it shows in their database and they can quickly deal with it.

Also nothing stops you from showing some kind of maturity, friendlynes and then trying to join the mod crew so you can deal with it yourself.

PS mods are just people like you. With RL stuff. Give them some slack. They don't really get paid for this it is just volunteering work. Mods are not Rioters. So maybe it is OK if they e9n't commit 3 hours a day just to sort out few threads that will fall down to oblivion pit in a couple of minutes since nobody reads or cares about them ;)
The mods are not volunteers, but a paid third party. They are not Rioters, but they do work 24/7.

the sad part is that a rioter makes 8 different posts in the disability thread.
